thread.title: Jelena Jankovic through to Hong Kong Open final after beating Venus Williams
thread.title_full: Jelena Jankovic through to Hong Kong Open final after beating Venus Williams

title: Jelena Jankovic through to Hong Kong Open final after beating Venus Williams
text:
Jelena Jankovic through to Hong Kong Open final after beating Venus Williams 17 Oct 2015 12:31:57 
comments 
Jelena Jankovic overcame Venus Williams in a battle of the former world number ones to set up a Hong Kong Open final clash with Angelique Kerber. 
The Serbian saved 14 of 16 break points in a match which lasted a shade over two hours and also hit back from 3-0 down in the second set to triumph 6-4 7-5 over the third seed. 
Jankovic, seeded fourth, told the WTA Tour website: "Playing against Venus is never an easy task. She's such a great champion and has been playing quite well the last month or so. 
"I'm happy with the way I played, though, and I'm really happy I was able to beat her." 
On her next opponent, Jankovic added: "She's a different player to Venus - she's so solid, she runs a lot of balls down and doesn't really give you any free points. 
"So I have to play really aggressive and try not to make any mistakes, and we'll see if I'm going to be able to win." 
Second seed Kerber needed just 71 minutes to thrash Sam Stosur 6-2 6-2. 
Australia's Stosur had triumphed in three of their five previous meetings but was no match for her German opponent on this occasion, with Kerber now just one win away from sealing her place at the WTA Finals in Singapore. 
"I'm feeling good after this match - I was playing good tennis," Kerber said. "It's always tough to play Sam. She's a great champion and a great opponent. So I'm really happy about my performance. 
"I'm not thinking too much about needing one more win tomorrow, though. It's going to be another day and another match, and I'm just going to try and play some good tennis and win the final here." Related Sport News
